meanings.definition: Each of the dorsal plates on a segment of an arthropod's body.
meanings.sent1: The tergites of the beetle were shiny and hard.
meanings.sent2: Arthropods have multiple tergites along their body segments.
meanings.sent3: The ant decided to decorate its tergites with tiny flower stickers.
meanings.sent4: The tergites of the centipede resembled a row of armored shields.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the intricate patterns on the tergites were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The dorsal part of an arthropod's body segment.
meanings.sent1: The tergites of the spider were segmented and flexible.
meanings.sent2: Insects rely on their tergites for protection and support.
meanings.sent3: The cricket threw a party on its tergites, inviting all its insect friends.
meanings.sent4: The tergites of the grasshopper arched gracefully as it leaped.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors on the tergites of the butterfly served as a warning to predators.
